CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 19, 1958, pg. 9 reads: "Agree on Judgement - Before Third Ward Alderman Sebastian D'epiro, right, management and union officials of Owl Cab Company, whose cabs have been off the streets since June 15, agreed that judgement for back pays and other monies of the drivers would be entered against the company. Attending were, seated, left to right: Clarence Hicks, union local president; Atty. J.C. Kuhn, the union's counsel; and Atty. Breci Leonard, representing Owl management.  Standing, left to right, are: John D. Patterson, union vice president Charles A. Quigley, the union's international representative; Kenneth Sherman, treasurer for the cab company; Howard Charles, vice president of the company; Charles Massie, union official; and Herbert Beans, Owl's president. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of ten men, seated left to right: Clarence Hicks, Atty. J.C. Kuhn, Atty. Breci Leonard, and Alderman Sebastian D'epiro; standing left to right: John D. Patterson, Charles A. Quigley, Kenneth Sherman, Howard Charles, Charles Massie, and Herbert Bean, gathered around desk with pens and gavel, in Alderman D'epiro's office
